name: Wensum Valley Hotel Golf and Country Club

reviews.text: Well on arrival I found out we had been upgraded, I thought good! On arrival in the room the was no tv remote, they sorted that. Went to turn the hall light on and the bulb had gone, then went to turn bed side lamp on and that bulb had gone too! Went to the bathroom and the door handle was hanging off! In the morning I went to a meeting before check out only to come back and find out that the room had been stripped and that the housekeepers were in it before check out time. The room was of a good size but was a bit tired. The staff were friendly enough though.
reviews.title: Not Good!!!! Avoid

reviews.text: I was horrified to read the previous reviews just 3 days before i accompanied my husband to a golfing weekend.....and when we pulled in and it looked like a barracks i was worse as i thought the reviews must be wrong. BUT, i have to say as someone who loves comfort this place was fine. It is 3 star...not 5!! We had tea & coffee making facillites in the room, lovely comfy kingsize bed, good shower. The breakfast is cooked to order, not buffet so hot and fresh. Cereals, fruit, yoghurt and juice and more toast than you can eat. Dinner we had Table D'hote menu with carvery which was fresh, nice and well presented. ALL staff friendly and the men really enjoyed the golf courses and they know their stuff! The pool also was good. If its golf you want, then go for it....really pleasantly surprised. It is a golf place though, not luxury spa!! Lots of functions both days we were there so people do use the place!! Go for it, just know what its purpose is.
reviews.title: Dont Be Put Off By Other Reviews....

reviews.text: I frequently use this hotel for business stays in Norfolk, it is privately run i believe, and offers the Gym facilities, pool, sauna, steam room, and what i am told by some of the local people i work with, two good golf courses. The location is excellent (i always ask for a room overlooking the golf course) with views over the Wensum Valley. I always find the staff helpful and the room rates are reasonable, the restaurant offers a good selection of food. I really cant understand why people would criticize, beats large corporate chains of hotels without personality any day.
reviews.title: A good hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: i really can't see why this place has had some bad reviews, 8 of us have just returned from a weekend golfing break and we all really enjoyed all they had to offer, the food was execeptional (carvery both days) for evening meal and the breakfast was fantastic, all the staff were very accommodating,both golf courses were very well laid out (the fairways were very dry but thats the weather)we preferred the valley course.
reviews.title: what a fantastic weekend of golf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the rooms were a little small but for a group of blokes on a jolly you really don't spend much time there, especially if you go into norwich for the night and stumble across a certain flavour chewing gum and a 1 horned big mammal.
reviews.title: DONT DO IT......buy a tent with the money it'll be more comfortable!!

reviews.text: Currently staying here on a trip for 4 nights arranged by and funded by work
reviews.title: Maybe if you play golf it's bearable

reviews.text: On the good side. The location is nice, the staff are great, the bar prices are low and the food is very good. There is a good gym, sauna and small pool
reviews.title: Yet another great stay at Wensum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the bad side. The rooms are comfortable and clean but it ends there
reviews.title: Unexpected Stay

reviews.text: The rooms are very dated and poorly equipped. There is a tiny old tv with 5 channels and no remote
reviews.title: Extremely friendly and helpful staff in delightful setting

reviews.text: The bathroom is straight from your grannies house in the 70's. Coloured suite, wooden toilet seat that won't stay up and a shower connected to the bath taps complete with shower curtain that sticks to you
reviews.title: Fantastic venue, service and food

reviews.text: A group of 13 travelled to the hotel for their New Years Eve Gala Ball. The rooms were clean and of a reasonable standard. We were lucky to be given the honeymoon suite which was huge with a spa bath although we didnt get change to use it. The walls are thin and we could hear the next door TV through the walls. The men played a round of golf while the women relaxed in the spa area which was pleasant and clean all included in the price. Although we had to walk outside to the function room this was undercover so not a problem. The ball was organized really well and the food was lovely. The DJ didnt get off to a good start but after some guests spoke to him the music did improve however this is personal choice I guess. There were Scottish pipers at Midnight which was a nice touch. The room was cleaned and ready to service breakfast at 7 the next morning and I was impressed you couldnt tell what had gone on the night before. Breakfast had a good selection and was tasty. We had a lovely stay thanks to the hard working staff.
reviews.title: New Years Eve Party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have just returned from an overnight stay at this hotel and after having read some reviews was rather anxious! On first impression the hotel is especially unattractive - looks more like a secondary school. Quite strange! Our double room was ok but very dated - it was also away from the reception area which meant a very short walk outside , through a door, up some stairs, through another door , down a corridor and opposite the beauty salon!. However the hotel was hosting several dinner /dances and this may have been a blessing in disguise as it was far enough away not to be bothered by the music.
reviews.title: lovely food, lovely service but unappealing hotel
don`t think your Xmas booking is safe
reviews.text: The dinner / dance we were attending was great - the service , the food, drink prices etc were all superb. They obviously know what they are doing in this area as there were several events happening all at once and it was beautifully organised.
Our room was very quiet BUT you could hear everything through the walls and out in the corridor - think we were just very fortunate not to have noisy neighbours!
reviews.title: Great food and leisure centre - shame about the rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great - a lovely choice and we were served at the table which is a lovely change. I had smoked salmon and scrambled egg!
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival, reception staffed served other customers with keys, who were queuing behind us, before checking us in. We had to ask for the bed linen to be changed as it obviously had not been after the previous guest had left, as there were several hairs in the bed and the sheets and pillows were crumpled and creased. There was also hairs in the sink. The room had not been hoovered, possibly for days, as there were lots of bits on the floor. The soundproofing is virtually non existent and we could hear everything going on in the room above. Especially when they came in at 0300 in the morning. The general cleanliness was not good, with cobwebs in the corner of the room and the carpets could have done with a good clean. On checking out the next morning we were not asked if we had enjoyed our
reviews.title: Go elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stay, possibly due to the receptionist being the same person that we had had to request the bedlinen change.
reviews.title: Enter at your peril!

reviews.text: My husband and I were booked to stay here for one night. We didnt complete our stay. We were directed to our room which we finally located through a maze of dingy concrete walkways remminisent of a 60's tennament block then into dimly lit corridors. All of which were a precursor of the horrors to come. Our room was to say the least, dated but more to the point, it was filthy. There appeared to be what looked like blood stains on the wall and carpet, thick dust pervayed the room as we disturbed it from the top of furnishings. Unpleasant looking stains were everywhere on the chairs and bed cover. The carpet and bathroom floor were so dirty that to remove ones shoes wouldve surely have been a health risk! We made an immediate complaint to reception who advised they would send someone up to our room. A housekeeper and cleaner duly arrived mop and bucket in hand. After pointing out all of the above, a sense of resignation came over the housekeeper and we were told that we were not the first to have complained ( and I suspect not the last) about the general standard of the place. Also that the complaints fell on deaf ears when the hotel owner had been told many times that the place needed attention! We left after only half an hour in the dreadful room/hotel. Fortunately there was little in the way of argument when we asked that we not be charged for the room.
reviews.title: Stayed at this hotel on and off over the...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel on and off over the last few months due to work. I would absolutely be gutted if I had booked to stay here myself. For what this place charges I would expect a nice room atleast with a tv that works and a bathroom with a shower that doesn't run scalding hot or freezing cold. The rooms are seriously out dated I feel like im back in the seventies or eighties..the location is the only advantage to this hotel. Some of the staff here are ignorant apart from one girl who works in the dinning area magda she is really polite and friendly. I would advise any one looking to stay here avoid it stay at a premier inn much nicer rooms and you get a good nights sleep for less money.
reviews.title: Very friendly, clean, good food, dont know what they are compaining about.

reviews.text: We stayed there in April whilst celebrating our Ruby wedding. It is a lovely place. The views are breathtaking. The place is clean. I think some of those other "guests" were staying in a different place.
reviews.title: Not too bad

description: Set in 350 acres of breathtaking Norfolk countryside you’ll have plenty to choose from at Wensum Valley Hotel Golf and Country Club. Perhaps you are thinking of taking a weekend break in Norfolk, or a Golf break in Norwich, and would like to be only 5 miles from Norwich’s nightlife, shopping and culture and just 30 minutes from the beautiful North Norfolk coastline. Our convenient location and transport links make us the perfect Norwich Airport Hotel. Whatever the purpose of your visit, anything is possible at Wensum Valley Hotel, Golf and Country Club.Wensum Valley Hotel offers 2 of the finest golf courses in Norfolk. Both 18-hole courses are free draining, meaning they are playable all year round with no temporary greens! Our 90 en-suite rooms are both comfortable and welcoming after a round on the course, fishing on the river Wensum or a day out in Norfolk.
